body_content.explanation: to add something in the middle of a text, piece of music, etc.:
examples: In his adaptation of the script he interpolated the words "tempus fugit" and the translation "time flies".
Coleridge-Taylor was keen on interpolating African-American spirituals into the classical music tradition.

body_content.explanation: to add a number or item into the middle of a series, calculated based on the numbers or items before and after it:
examples: They use special software to intelligently interpolate the missing values.
Additional jobs are evaluated and their monetary values for each factor interpolated into the scale.

body_content.explanation: to interrupt someone by saying something:
examples: "How very odd to say all that!" I interpolated.
